Then Solomon’s workers started to build the temple for Yahweh in Jerusalem. They built it on Moriah Hill, where
Yahweh had appeared to his father David. They built it on the ground that Araunah, a descendant of the Jebus people-group, had sold to David and where David said that it should be built.
They began the work in April, when Solomon had been ruling almost four years.
The foundation of the temple was about 90 feet long and 30 feet wide.
The entrance room across the front of the temple was 30 feet wide and 30 feet high.
